item.title: Clip, but crop first!
item.description: I often clip raster in R, with sf and raster it is straightforward and efficient. That said, I’d like to mention one tip tip R users that clip should be aware of: cropping before clipping. It does significantly improve the performance, as shown in the R script below: library(sf) library(raster) library(tidyverse) ## download Canada boundaries (level of the county) ont <- getData("GADM", country = "CAN", level = 2) %>% st_as_sf %>% filter(NAME_1 == "Ontario") ## Download elevation raster (NB resolution is coarse) can_elv <- getData("alt", country = "CAN") R> system.
